Obviously it's an ntr, why? The fact that the mc's outlook on the fmc is in contrary to fmc's lust hankering persona, to the mc's perspective fmc is a good natured person that won't succumbed to such indecent desires, yet his own expectations betrayed him because he doesn't knew the girl that looked so presteigne and pure was plowed by a chad on a whim, that stands as a betrayal to me, well it might be not that kind of infidelity ur familiar with but that mental constraint it gave is somehow the same regardless of the differ in situation and relationship status

Suck for him but this is why communication is important. If you have a crush on someone, take your shot, be confident. At least at the end of the day, you make your feelings clear. 
And if you got your heartbroken, just know that it’s a temporary thing. Eventually, the food will be tasty again, the music will be great again, you’ll laugh and happy again, someone new will show up in your life. You’ll be fine, and life still carries on
I think I'm going to commit suicide, right now
For guys like the MC, just the embrace of death remains for us.
Deserved for being a faggot.

Fuck, you motherfuckers are triggering me. NTR isn't cheating. Otherwise there wouldn't have to be a cheating tag AND a NTR tag. Ntr is about something you love, and thinking you couldn't lose, being taken away. That's why there's so many childhood friend, mother, distant admirer netorare. Every netorare has the same point in the end, don't be a cuck and wait for something to happen because someone else is going to make a move; and women are also living conscious beings who will also choose the better person, no different than men. 

Also, stop crying in the comments, what the fuck. Post-no-comments era, everyone seems to be so soft. What happened to the memes. Now's it's just people crying about their own love life. Tf happened
This goes out to all the ones who got their hearts broken: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=RBumgq5yVrA

Certain people falsely believe that the protagonists need to be in a relationship for a story to be netorare. These cucks think that the story needs to have some sort of cheating and a heroine forced into having sex, like in their fantasies. If there isn't they'll comment that the story isn't NTR.
Main definition of every literal comment here is saying "it's not an ntr"

It wasn't really NTR, am I the only one who thinks so? The two were never in a relationship in the first place, so why call it NTR if the girl went for the other guy instead and not go for the other guy *while being with* the other?

This goes out to all the ones who got their hearts broken:
https://youtu.be/gjgkxjfYHsE

well it wasn't NTR but it still sucked. but this goes to show you. those who are assertive usually win. And she never had feelings for the MC if we can call him that. it also showed shes just like any type of girl at  the end of the day. and when the guy is done he'll m ove onto the next one.

Guy will find someone . one day.

They probably don't get how can ppl enjoy NTR, which usually consist of 'tragic' relationships between MC and the girl in question that got netorare'd. I'm totally not a fan of NTRash since when someone reads enough of them and know real life relationships, 99% of the time of these situations are fabricated and so not likely to happen, and of course, don't forget they are work of fiction. I read them because they are, for me, a form of entertainment. How so? Think about this: it's like you have a bag of jelly beans with a bunch of flavors, some are sweet but some are sour, and even some might taste like shit and just spit it out. That's it! Don't take it seriously. If you do, you are emotionally unstable and so I suggest you work on them.

So, before you guys post NTR-hating comments, don't bother but if you are hurt or crying from this, here is a sweet wholesome story by Hiroya to heal you (cmon guys, I'm on your side, I love good vanilla stories too!): https://nhentai.net/g/344844/

"The street we walked together on that rainy day was ironically as sunny as it could be."

bruuuuhhhhh....

@Still birgin, yes it is ntr. Because ntr doesn't mean cheating it means to be stolen away. So at the start of the story they both liked each other but right before they were going to get together she got stolen away from him. That's why on here there's cheating tags then there's ntr. Cheating means there's not addiction or attachment its just sex but with ntr the person wants more.
